author: Odeinoichus
title: Seven tentacles does not = Octopus.
review:
Set #71019 Shark Army Octopus: Here we find the next figure released for the Shark Army in the LEGO Ninjago Movie CMF series and it's a generic warrior.

The SAO features a single-sided torso print with leg printing for an underwater wetsuit that is quite different from something you see in the real world. He also includes a new breathing tank element which adds some printing on the front for the air level in the tank. His accessories include a stud-shooter and a fish... really silly weapon, but it's standard Shark Army weaponry judging by what we see in the sets.

The new head piece has seven legs, not eight, which means this Octopus helmet is missing one of the limbs, but I suppose that makes sense considering Garmadon came up with the look of his army, he probably thought it would be cool or something.

Overall I like the look of this figure and recommend him.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: Nice , but would have preferred to get a different one from the series
review:
Opening;

The shark army octopus is a nice figure but not particularly unique in the long run .

The Minifigure-

He has a very strange but cool octopus head attachment ( highlight of the fig ) with eye printing , his head has a grumpy expression and a scar above his eye , they have a gun metal grey air tank and a printed torso which leads into the legs .

The accessories -

His accessories include a dull silver fish and a boring light grey stud shooter with three extra studs in Trans orange . His stand is the standard black CMF stand .

In conclusion-

this is a fine figure but personally I would prefer to get th jay or sushi chef from the series instead but it is not a bad figure but doesn't stand out with the other shark army figures littered throughout the Ninjago movie wave .
